p: Cobalt (Co) is an activator of various enzymes in the body and is mainly involved in the synthesis of Vitamin B 12 as Cobalt is a co-factor of Vitamin B 12. A small amount of cobalt is able to enhance the reproductive capacity of ruminants, while a lack of cobalt often leads to pernicious anemia, dysplasia, low birth rate, reduced milk, weakly born young, and a low rate of weaning survival in livestock [ 7, 8].
